answerText: self-consistent field method [or SCF; or Hartree-Fock method; or HF method][10] The SCF method solves the time-independent Schrödinger equation, and thus computes states with this property of having unchanging probability density. This term also denotes one of the phases used in chromatography.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Dorman-Carleton-LASA B | 3 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this method of approximately computing the state of a multi-electron atom, in which the energy eigenfunctions are described by Slater determinants, corresponding to orbitals.
